title: DS320.04 Introduction: Web UI | DataStax Enterprise Analytics
description:
#DataStaxAcademy #DS320
DS320.04 Introduction: Web UI
In this course, you will learn how to effectively and efficiently solve analytical problems with Apache Spark™, Apache Cassandra™, and DataStax Enterprise. You will learn about the Spark API, Spark-Cassandra Connector, Spark SQL, Spark Streaming, and crucial performance optimization techniques.  You will also learn the basics of the productive and robust Scala programming language for data analysis and processing in Apache Spark™.

LEARN FOR FREE at https://academy.datastax.com -- access all the FREE complete courses, tutorials, and hands-on exercises.

ASK QUESTIONS at https://community.datastax.com -- where experts from DataStax & the Apache Cassandra community share their expertise everyday.

transcript.text: [Music] if you'd like a little bit of a view into how spark is managing its work internally it exposes two separate web uis the master node exposes one and the spark driver exposes an application web ui as well the master web ui is going to expose information about the master node and running applications and worker nodes the application web ui is going to display information about completed jobs tasks executors and so forth now you may have more than one application running of course in a given environment and so as you can see the port number which defaults to 4040 for the first application web ui just keeps increasing by one as multiple applications run on that same host you go to 4041 4042 and so forth now let me underscore this point about the application web ui this is actually the spark driver exposing this web server so the application that has the spark code running on it that's the thing that exposes this web server and gives you information administrative information about what is going on in that driver here's a quick look at what the spark master web ui looks like just in a screenshot as a spark 1.4.1 some workers are listed and a running application is listed and here's a view of the application web ui as you can see this is a bit more complex there are many tabs and we see some stages listed here on this particular tab we could also look at jobs and storage and executors and all those things all that information is exposed by this ui we're not going to dig deeply into it right now we're really just trying to make you aware that it's there and that it exposes the state of the application to you as a developer or an administrator
